title: Ruislip Lido Walking Route

images.title: Nigel Cox / Ruislip Lido Railway
images.caption: Ruislip Lido Railway. These are the points on the 12" gauge line at the eastern approach to TQ0889 : Haste Hill station and turntable. It should be noted that the railway is securely protected by high fences against casual trespass by members of the public and this image was taken either through or over the top of the fence.

images.caption: Ruislip Park Woodland trails. Just to the south of the lake.

description: Enjoy an easy circular walk around this pretty reservoir on Ruislip Common. The lake is a popular spot in the summer with its artificial beach and super Mini gauge railway. There's also nice walking trails around the water and through the adjacent woodland. There are two car parks on site or you can catch the tube to Ruislip tube station.  Please see the link below for additional parking and public transport details. After your walk you can enjoy refreshments at the lake side cafe and visit the Woodland Centre where you can learn about the history of the area. It's easy to extend your walk by heading into Bayhurst Wood Country Park and Ruislip Woods . You can follow the Hillingdon Trail west through Mad Bess Woods. If you follow the trail south you will soon come to Ickenham where you can enjoy another waterside walk along the Yeading Brook . For cyclists London Cycle Network Route 89 passes through Ruislip just to the south of the lake. You can follow the route from Uxbridge and West Drayton.
